docs.snippet: The old man walked with a cane, but his blue eyes were bright with the hope that comes from more the half a century of playing horses.

headline.main: Search on for Clues to Ringers' Roots; A Racing Day Where Mystery Began

byline.original: By PAUL L. MONTGOMERY Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 6 The investigation of the switch of the Uruguayan race horses, Cinzano and Lebon, in the United States this summer is focusing on the activities here in May of Luis Donamari, a small, nervous horse dealer, and Mrs. Alice...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 6 The investigation of the switch of the Uruguayan race horses, Cinzano and Lebon, in the United States this summer is focusing on the activities here in May of Luis Donamari, a small, nervous horse dealer, and Mrs. Alice Gerard, the wife of the Muttontown, L.I, veterinarian who was the buyer of record of both thoroughbreds.

headline.main: Gerard's Wife Focus of Inquiry In Ringer Case; New York Investigators in Uruguay Check On Mrs. Gerard

byline.original: By PAUL L. MONTGOMERY Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 Relations between the United States and Brazil, already strained, appear to have worsened with the broadcast to Brazil by the Voice of America of an interview with an exiled Brazilian political leader.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 Relations between the United States and Brazil, already strained, appear to have worsened with the broadcast to Brazil by the Voice of America of an interview with an exiled Brazilian political leader.
docs.abstract: relations worsen with Voice of Amer broadcast of int with exiled pol leader Leonel Brizola, former gov of State of Rio Grande do Sul and bro-in-law of late Pres Joao Goulart (M)

headline.main: U.S. Broadcast to Brazil Appears To Add to the Strains in Relations

byline.original: By GRAHAM HOVEY Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: Two weeks after being suspended for "possible racing fraud," Dr. Mark Gerard remains almost as much a mystery as the ringer case that caused his troubles.
docs.lead_paragraph: Two weeks after being suspended for "possible racing fraud," Dr. Mark Gerard remains almost as much a mystery as the ringer case that caused his troubles.

headline.main: Veterinarian in Ringer Case Remains a Man of Mystery

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay Nov. 7 The horsemen Investigating the Cinzano-Lebon switch that had its roots here in May have been satisfied and returned today to the United States, but the prosecutors stayed on to squeeze out further evidence.

docs.abstract: some investigators leave Uruguay but J William Moksen of Nassau County Dist Atty's office remains (S)

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 9 In the backwash of the horse-switching scandal in the United States, breeders and exporters here are concerned about the suddenly weak market for their products.

byline.original: By PAUL L. MONTGOMERY Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: The Food and Agricultural Organization of the United Nations is recognizing distinguished women in the world. Last month Canadian educator, Dr. Pauline Jewett, was  awarded the FAO Ceres Medal named for the Roman goddess of agriculture.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Food and Agricultural Organization of the United Nations is recognizing distinguished women in the world. Last month Canadian educator, Dr. Pauline Jewett, was awarded the FAO Ceres Medal named for the Roman goddess of agriculture.
docs.abstract: FAO awards Ceres Medal to Canadian educator Dr Pauline Jewett; Ceres program stresses crucial role of women in soc and econ development the world over; some previous recipients noted; medal illus (S)
